description: Diagnostic arthroscopy as a stand-alone procedure for evaluation of shoulder pathology when advanced imaging is inconclusive (Evidence: pg no: 4, L154-L155)
scope: Stand-alone diagnostic procedure (Evidence: pg no: 4, L154-L155)

documentation: Function-limiting pain for at least six (6) months in duration (Evidence: pg no: 4, L156-L157)
Abnormal shoulder physical examination findings compared to non-involved side including functionally limited range of motion or measurable loss in strength (Evidence: pg no: 4, L158-L161)
Positive Neer Impingement Test or Hawkins-Kennedy Impingement Test (Evidence: pg no: 4, L162)
Failure of provider-directed non-surgical management for at least three (3) months in duration (Evidence: pg no: 4, L163-L164)
Advanced diagnostic imaging study (e.g., MRI, CT) is inconclusive for internal derangement/pathology (Evidence: pg no: 4, L165)

Other potential pathological conditions have been excluded including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 4, L166-L168)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 5, L171-L172)
In-office diagnostic arthroscopy (e.g., Mi-Eye™, VisionScope®) - considered experimental, investigational, or unproven (Evidence: pg no: 5, L175-L176)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, shoulder, diagnostic, with or without synovial biopsy (separate procedure) (Evidence: pg no: 13, L556)

notes: Considered medically necessary only when ALL criteria are met (Evidence: pg no: 4, L155)
